c74object.name: o.tap
c74object.description: Send bangs to extract tempo in beats-per-minute.

inlet.description:
Outputs the elapsed time in beats-per-minute from the currently received bang to the previous.
Note: if the time between bangs is bigger than the time-window argument o.tap will reset its time count. This is quite useful in live performance situations, when you need to tap the tempo in two different sections, but you want to ignore the elapsed time between the first and the second tap situations.

outlet.description:
Outputs the elapsed time in beats-per-minute from the currently received bang to the previous.
Note: if the time between bangs is bigger than the time-window argument o.tap will reset its time count. This is quite useful in live performance situations, when you need to tap the tempo in two different sections, but you want to ignore the elapsed time between the first and the second tap situations.

objarg.name: time-window
objarg.description: A time window in milliseconds in which o.tap operates to calculate a bpm value. If the time elapsed between input bangs exceeds this value, o.tap will restart its elapsed time calculation, starting from 0 again.

method.name: int
method.description: A time window in milliseconds in which o.tap operates to calculate a bpm value. If the time elapsed between input bangs exceeds this value, o.tap will restart its elapsed time calculation, starting from 0 again.

method.name: bang
method.description:
Output the elapsed time in beats-per-minute between the two previous input bangs.
Note: when o.tap is instatiated, has received the reset or the elapsed time between input bangs is bigger than the time-window attribute, the object will only send values to the outlet after the second bang has been received. This can be quite useful in performance situations, where you don't want to output any values that aren't related to the time you are currently tapping.

method.name: reset
method.description:
Resets o.tap so that it will only output a tempo value after the second bang has been received.
The time-window attribute will automatically reset o.tap when the interval between two bangs is bigger than the time-window value (in milliseconds).

entry.name: float
entry.description:
Outputs the elapsed time between two input bangs in beats-per-minute.
Note: when o.tap is instatiated, has received the reset or the elapsed time between input bangs is bigger than the time-window attribute, the object will only send values to the outlet after the second bang has been received. This can be quite useful in performance situations, where you don't want to output any values that aren't related to the time you are currently tapping.
